channel.title: Ive Had an issue
channel.description:
Ok well months ago we had to buy a new vps this was in around early January late December and we were down for around an hour or two and we got down to 97% uptime , now months later never going offline unless for an update which takes 2 seconds. It has been 99% , I was wondering if it could be 100% it would greatly increase the amount of players coming into are server. If you are able to do so I thank you.
-RuneFuse

item.title: Ive Had an issue
item.dc:creator: @dan_v_jad dan v jad
item.description:
@dan_v_jad wrote:

Never had the chance to thank you for removing my advert, Mopar

So many thanks to you!

Also thanks DeathChaos for explaining a little more too

Read full topic

item.title: Ive Had an issue
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“dan v jad, post:7, topic:541568”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=660439.msg4433390#msg4433390 date=1404226264]
Currently the only way to get up to 100% again is via rounding error, because this keeps track of your uptime over all time.

In the near future, I plan on allowing you to pick a time period to see uptime over, and then the default can be set to 6 months or 1 year or something allowing you to get back up to 100%.
[/quote]

I stopped hosting for 8 months, and was left unable to remove my server from the toplist… and I’ve just come back to it all and i know the only way to of got around this would be to make a new account; but i don’t feel i should need to… My server is now stuck with a low up-time, I’ve revamped the listing however I’m certain I can keep it above 98% like before… Any solution at all? I’d be willing to lose all my votes if i can get the listing reset (or ability to make a new listing, with the old one deleted)

p.s this also means I shouldn’t be eligible here I think… under a certain uptime :P[/quote]

Until I implement the above, the only solution would be to ask me to delete it. I have now done so.

Read full topic

item.title: Ive Had an issue
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

[quote=“dan v jad, post:7, topic:541568”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=660439.msg4433390#msg4433390 date=1404226264]
Currently the only way to get up to 100% again is via rounding error, because this keeps track of your uptime over all time.

In the near future, I plan on allowing you to pick a time period to see uptime over, and then the default can be set to 6 months or 1 year or something allowing you to get back up to 100%.
[/quote]

I stopped hosting for 8 months, and was left unable to remove my server from the toplist… and I’ve just come back to it all and i know the only way to of got around this would be to make a new account; but i don’t feel i should need to… My server is now stuck with a low up-time, I’ve revamped the listing however I’m certain I can keep it above 98% like before… Any solution at all? I’d be willing to lose all my votes if i can get the listing reset (or ability to make a new listing, with the old one deleted)

p.s this also means I shouldn’t be eligible here I think… under a certain uptime :P[/quote]
As of now you don’t have many options sadly…

A. You can point your advertisement to an IP & port that aren’t being used. Your server will appear offline and when the uptime reaches 40% it is automatically removed from the MoparScape Server Status Page. At that time you can register your server once again.
B. You can maintain uptime and when your uptime hits 99.5% the Server Status Page will turn it in to 100% once again.

Posting a new advertisement for an existing server is against the rules. Nothing else you can do without breaking rules I’m afraid.

Read full topic
